meanings.sent1: She always manages to outdream her friends with her vivid imagination.
meanings.sent2: I hope to outdream my fears and have peaceful dreams tonight.
meanings.sent3: The little girl would outdream the clouds, imagining shapes and stories in the sky.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outdream reality made him a great storyteller.
meanings.sent5: Outdreaming the stars, she created her own galaxy in her mind.

meanings.definition: To have more dreams or better dreams than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He would often outdream his siblings, waking up with exciting tales to tell.
meanings.sent2: I want to outdream my previous night's dream and have an even more magical experience.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to outdream the dog, twitching and purring in its sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams would outdream any movie, full of adventure and wonder.
meanings.sent5: Outdreaming everyone else, he had the most fantastical dreams in the whole town.
